intro: Alstonia lenormandii, commonly known as the Madagascar flame tree, is a tropical tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a thick, branched trunk and can grow up to 20 meters tall in its natural habitat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its bark is rough and fissured. Alstonia lenormandii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display.
